page.title: 02EAST KILBRIDE AND THE CHURCH
page.content: EAST KILBRIDE AND THE CHURCH. Most of our population belong to the {CHURCH OF SCOTLAND,}our country's National Church,and are of Protestant faith.Our local congregation meet in CLAREMONT CHURCH,which was built in 1971.A church of the same name existed in GLASGOW,but due to members moving out to overspill areas such as East Kilbride,it was forced to close its doors.The money made from its sale was given to a small congregation in East Kilbride to build a new church for a new community.It was suitably named Claremont Church and now has a member ship of 2000. Mr Steven,the minister at the church, visits our school once every two weeks to talk to us about JESUS and how we should follow his example.At the end of school term our whole school visits the church for a thanksgiving service.
